jobTitle: Real Estate Sales Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50628525.txt	§Real Estate Sales§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Real Estate Sales§§Advertiser: §REAP Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Salary§§LODGE REAL ESTATE§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Sales§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Real Estate Sales §    §    §      §        §Since opening their first office in Hamilton in 1969, Lodge Real Estate have established themselves as Hamilton’s real estate industry leader. The Lodge Group is now comprised of five specialty businesses focusing on Residential Sales, Residential Property Management, Rural Sales, Commercial Sales and Leasing and Body Corporate Management.§  § Lodge Real Estate currently have opportunities for §New & Experienced Salespeople§ to join their team and with eight offices across the Hamilton region there’s an opportunity for you today in your local neighbourhood. Lodge Real Estate remain devoted to constantly exceeding the benchmarks they have set in the real estate industry and whether you are new to real estate, just getting started or a “seasoned pro” then Lodge Real Estate can offer§          §            §A management team with over 80 years collective real estate sales experience§            §A culture of trust, integrity, excellence, individuality and innovation§            §Access to the best trainers from international and local specialists§            §Fast-track to success programme with weekly mentoring programmes§            §Fresh ideas and innovative marketing techniques§            §Strategic alliance network with the largest independent companies throughout New Zealand§            §National referral network of buyers and sellers§          § §New to Real Estate?§ If you're planning on entering the real estate industry, then you must obtain a Salesperson's Licence from the Real Estate Agents Authority before being able to commence work. Lodge Real Estate can assist you with this process and can offer you a Real Estate Start Up Scholarship Programme. Previous Residential Sales experience is NOT a requirement, but a friendly and personable approach is. §  § §Currently Working in Real Estate?§ If you are currently working in Real Estate (or underway with your studies) then please consider what Lodge Real Estate can offer you to be successful.  Lodge Real Estate’s size ensures you specialise in one area of real estate only, maintaining your focus being the key to maximising your potential. Their powerful media presence and significant market share in all aspects of real estate generates more buyers and sellers.§  § Lodge are an integral part of Hamilton and have grown as Hamilton has grown.  They are keen to continue to grow and would love for you to be a part of it. With a desire from the outset of having a close connection with the communities they serve they provide sponsorship to teams such as Hamilton Boys High School 1st XV, Frankton Athletics, Waikato Diocesan Rowing and Marist Rugby.  The also assist with events such as the Fine Homes Tour which has raised hundreds of thousands of dollars for Hamilton charities.§  § Perhaps all of the above (and more) is why their Salespeople have been recognised as the region's best in industry awards.§  § §This role is being managed by REAP Recruitment. Please apply on-line below to be considered for this role.  All applications will remain confidential to REAP Recruitment & Lodge Real Estate and will only be forwarded on to others with your consent.§  § REAP Recruitment specialise in recruitment for the Real Estate and Property (REAP) industries.  We are your independent choice whether you're wanting to see if the "grass is greener" or looking for a new role in Real Estate.   If you're thinking about your career in Real Estate, then make REAP Recruitment your first call.§        §      §      §Matt Hunter§APPLY ON-LINE §    §    §  §§§Since opening their first office in Hamilton in 1969, Lodge Real Estate have established themselves as Hamilton’s real estate industry leader. The Lodge Group is now comprised of five specialty businesses focusing on Residential Sales, Residential Property Management, Rural Sales, Commercial Sales and Leasing and Body Corporate Management.§  § Lodge Real Estate currently have opportunities for §New & Experienced Salespeople§ to join their team and with eight offices across the Hamilton region there’s an opportunity for you today in your local neighbourhood. Lodge Real Estate remain devoted to constantly exceeding the benchmarks they have set in the real estate industry and whether you are new to real estate, just getting started or a “seasoned pro” then Lodge Real Estate can offer§ § §A management team with over 80 years collective real estate sales experience§ §A culture of trust, integrity, excellence, individuality and innovation§ §Access to the best trainers from international and local specialists§ §Fast-track to success programme with weekly mentoring programmes§ §Fresh ideas and innovative marketing techniques§ §Strategic alliance network with the largest independent companies throughout New Zealand§ §National referral network of buyers and sellers§ § §New to Real Estate?§ If you're planning on entering the real estate industry, then you must obtain a Salesperson's Licence from the Real Estate Agents Authority before being able to commence work. Lodge Real Estate can assist you with this process and can offer you a Real Estate Start Up Scholarship Programme. Previous Residential Sales experience is NOT a requirement, but a friendly and personable approach is. §  § §Currently Working in Real Estate?§ If you are currently working in Real Estate (or underway with your studies) then please consider what Lodge Real Estate can offer you to be successful.  Lodge Real Estate’s size ensures you specialise in one area of real estate only, maintaining your focus being the key to maximising your potential. Their powerful media presence and significant market share in all aspects of real estate generates more buyers and sellers.§  § Lodge are an integral part of Hamilton and have grown as Hamilton has grown.  They are keen to continue to grow and would love for you to be a part of it. With a desire from the outset of having a close connection with the communities they serve they provide sponsorship to teams such as Hamilton Boys High School 1st XV, Frankton Athletics, Waikato Diocesan Rowing and Marist Rugby.  The also assist with events such as the Fine Homes Tour which has raised hundreds of thousands of dollars for Hamilton charities.§  § Perhaps all of the above (and more) is why their Salespeople have been recognised as the region's best in industry awards.§  § §This role is being managed by REAP Recruitment. Please apply on-line below to be considered for this role.  All applications will remain confidential to REAP Recruitment & Lodge Real Estate and will only be forwarded on to others with your consent.§  § REAP Recruitment specialise in recruitment for the Real Estate and Property (REAP) industries.  We are your independent choice whether you're wanting to see if the "grass is greener" or looking for a new role in Real Estate.   If you're thinking about your career in Real Estate, then make REAP Recruitment your first call.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50628804.txt	§Commercial Property Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Commercial Property Analyst§§Advertiser: §Franklin Smith Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Salary§§$70,000 - $75,000 p.a. + Bonuses§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Analysts§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Commercial Property Analyst §      §        § §The Business§        § Operating for almost 3 decades and a proven track record for generating and sustaining wealth for their investors. They have a dedicated ‘in-house’ Property Management division who are responsible for managing over $300 million of commercial and industrial property across Tauranga, Rotorua, Taupo, Hamilton, Auckland and Whangarei.§        § In this role you will have the chance to grow your commercial property analyst experience, receive an attractive salary and grow within the business§        § §The Role§        § You'll be working closely with our Asset Management and Investment teams in the information management and data analysis of our day-to-day property and property transaction decisions§ You will additionally be responsible for the duties:§        §          §Develop systems, tools, resources, and processes that work for both asset management and transactions management functions§          §Assist in the due diligence process for new business;§          §Support the preparation of market disclosures, and any investor relation material§          §Liaise with other parts of the wider business to finalise investment analysis and reporting;§          §Invoices and issuing contracts§          §Undertake property investment analysis to support the business in making informed, evidence-based decisions§        §        § §About you§        § To be considered for this opportunity you will have the following:§        §          §A Property degree§          §3-5 years property analyst experience OR strong background in property valuations§          §Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite with an emphasis on Excel, Word and Outlook§          §A strong attention to detail with the ability to prioritise and juggle multiple job functions§        §        § § To learn more or to see a full job description, please submit your interest via the link above, or alternatively for a confidential discussion please contact Jason Goodson at Franklin Smith Group on §092812862§ or email your CV to §jason@franklinsmithgroup.co.nz§      §    §    §www.franklinsmithgroup.co.nz§  §§§ §The Business§ Operating for almost 3 decades and a proven track record for generating and sustaining wealth for their investors. They own, develop and manage industrial real estate assets, with assets under management of $51.6B. The portfolio consists of high-quality properties in key locations, with dedicated local teams who manage all aspects of property, asset and investment management. Goodman’s investors include sovereign wealth, pension and large multi-manager funds. In New Zealand, Goodman manages the NZX listed Goodman Property Trust with a portfolio of $3.1bn§   § Goodman is known as an employer of choice, attracting and retaining high calibre employees. These employees are central to Goodman’s success, ensuring customers and investors receive high quality service, as well as innovative property and investment solutions.§ §The Opportunity§ Reporting through to the Operations Manager for Property Services, the Operations Analyst is a new position due to the continued growth of the Goodman business. Our teams are professional, focused on delivery of best practice on Parks Maintenance services to our clients and the members of the public.§        §We are now looking for a Contract Manager to join our team looking after the beautiful parks and reserves in the Waitaki District.  You will be responsible for the operational and financial management of maintenance contracts and projects, being the liaison with Council, addressing technical issues, quality management, planning and auditing of Downer activities, assisting in developing and maintaining business systems supporting OSM activities and leading a great team.§        §We would like to hear from you if you have:§        §          §Knowledge and experience in Facilities Management, and/or Open Space Management§          §Knowledge and experience of the contractual and financial aspects of Contract Management§          §Can confidently work with business systems and processes§          §High level written and verbal communication skills as you will be liaising closely with internal staff, as well as sub-contractors and clients§          §Computer literacy§        §        §A role with us can enable you to develop and enhance your skills and experience.  This is a great opportunity for you to join our diverse and inclusive culture and be part of a great team thriving in a collaborative fast-paced environment.  We will reward you with a competitive remuneration package, flexible working arrangements, great training and ongoing development, and the opportunity to advance your career within our organisation.  §        §If this sounds like the opportunity for you, head to §www.downercareers.co.nz§ and enter reference number 573591 to apply. §    §        §Downer NZ is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture §        §Our workplaces are drug and alcohol free - all successful applicants will be required to undertake a pre-employment drug test and medical.  §        §Due to the fast-paced nature of Downer, our vacancy close dates may be subject to change, so don't delay and make sure you apply as soon as possible.§ §        §Please note we have an in-house recruitment team that manage all our vacancies. No candidates presented through an agency will be considered for any of our roles advertised, unless previously arranged. We would strongly encourage all candidates interested in these roles, to apply directly online through the portal provided otherwise your application will not be considered. §      §      §      §    §    §www.downer.co.nz§  §§§Downer New Zealand is a leading provider of integrated services.  Our commitment to building long term relationships and supporting our customers with high calibre services and solutions; the talents of our people; and consistent excellence in operational delivery sets us apart.§Downer Open Space Management  have an enviable record of delivery to the highest standards across New Zealand as part of parks contracts being delivered to a wide range of clients nationwide. Our teams are professional, focused on delivery of best practice on Parks Maintenance services to our clients and the members of the public.§We are now looking for a Contract Manager to join our team looking after the beautiful parks and reserves in the Waitaki District.  You will be responsible for the operational and financial management of maintenance contracts and projects, being the liaison with Council, addressing technical issues, quality management, planning and auditing of Downer activities, assisting in developing and maintaining business systems supporting OSM activities and leading a great team.§We would like to hear from you if you have:§§Knowledge and experience in Facilities Management, and/or Open Space Management§Knowledge and experience of the contractual and financial aspects of Contract Management§Can confidently work with business systems and processes§High level written and verbal communication skills as you will be liaising closely with internal staff, as well as sub-contractors and clients§Computer literacy§§A role with us can enable you to develop and enhance your skills and experience.  This is a great opportunity for you to join our diverse and inclusive culture and be part of a great team thriving in a collaborative fast-paced environment.  We will reward you with a competitive remuneration package, flexible working arrangements, great training and ongoing development, and the opportunity to advance your career within our organisation.  §If this sounds like the opportunity for you, head to §www.downercareers.co.nz§ and enter reference number 573591 to apply. §    §Downer NZ is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture §Our workplaces are drug and alcohol free - all successful applicants will be required to undertake a pre-employment drug test and medical.  §Due to the fast-paced nature of Downer, our vacancy close dates may be subject to change, so don't delay and make sure you apply as soon as possible.§ §Please note we have an in-house recruitment team that manage all our vacancies. No candidates presented through an agency will be considered for any of our roles advertised, unless previously arranged. We would strongly encourage all candidates interested in these roles, to apply directly online through the portal provided otherwise your application will not be considered. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50634127.txt	§Real Estate Sales assistant - Mandarin speaking with current RE licence required§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Real Estate Sales assistant - Mandarin speaking with current RE licence required§§Advertiser: §Bayleys Howick§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Sales§§§§§§If you are looking for a new and exciting opportunity to enhance your career, or if you are just starting out in Real Estate, this could be a great opportunity.§ §Bayleys Howick covers a large area from Bucklands Beach to Whitford and beyond. Covering a diverse property portfolio, agents are able to choose to sell anything from modest units to the most luxurious lifestyle mansions. § §We are a very busy office and need agents and/or agent assistants to help meet our clients' needs. All levels of experience are invited and packages are competitive and will reflect your ability. We are particularly keen to hear from sale-people that are Mandarin speaking. Many within our current team need help from licensees that can converse in Chinese and this is a fantastic opportunity to learn from some of the most established agents in the industry and help them sell their listings. We also offer a current database with many Chinese buyers for the successful candidate. A current real estate salesperson licence is essential.§ §Being a Real Estate Agent with Bayleys is an opportunity to make make serious income and have the support to ensure that lifestyle can be great too. Bayleys Howick has a very high average earning. All agents are supported by a dedicated administrator.§ §With our top performers overseas trips, outstanding conference and awards dinners as well as engaging weekly meetings that celebrate success, the culture at Bayleys Howick is hard to beat. We are in a vibrant village making it a great place to work.§ §If this sounds like it could be a good move for you, please apply with a cover letter letting including your phone number. If you have any questions, feel free to call Sam Rosenberg, Sales Manager on 021 558 781.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobText: TXT/50636832.txt	§Retail Facilities Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Retail Facilities Manager§§Advertiser: §Colliers International§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Body Corporate & Facilities Management§§§§§§ § §Company Description§ §Colliers International is a global property services company operating across 68 countries. We have a workforce of more than 17,000 professionals who think differently, share great ideas and provide service excellence to their clients. § § § §Job Description§ §We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Facilities Manager to join our Real Estate Management team in our Auckland CBD office. We are looking for a motivated professional to undertake effective facilities administration and strategic oversight of a portfolio of Shopping Centres and retail properties in the Auckland region.§ § § §Responsibilities§ § §Ensure portfolio is properly maintained and compliance requirements are adhered to§ §Manage building performance in a cost-effective manner in accordance with best practice and individual owners’ wishes§ §Develop and maintain strong working relationships with property managers, clients, tenants, contractors, and other stakeholders§ §Prepare and contribute to client reporting and budgeting§ §Identify and execute on genuine asset value-add ideas and concepts including operational efficiencies and procurement§ §Assist the wider team with tasks and workload§ §Oversee CAPEX projects and long-term maintenance plans§ §Assist and develop sustainability, technology and environmental strategy and initiatives§ §Review and refresh all operational policies and processes§ § § §Qualifications§ § §3+ years’ experience in a similar position§ §Strong written and verbal communication skills§ §Strong client-focus and relationship building skills§ §Strong stakeholder management skills§ §Strong presentation skills§ §Self-motivated and deadline-focussed§ §Diligent and conscientious§ §Strong time management skills§ § § §Additional Information§ §Our enterprising culture empowers our people to do their best work, collaborating with our global experts to maximise every opportunity and lead the industry. For you, this means a world of opportunity and the platform to learn, grow and succeed.§§§§

property management expertise to the shopping centres owned and/ or managed by AMP Capital Investor’s various property funds and private clients.§        § §        §The role:§        §An exciting opportunity has arisen for an experienced Digital Marketing Executive to join the team at Botany Town Centre.§        §The role is responsible for supporting the Marketing team in developing, the digital, social, and digital analytics platforms for the centre, including website, EDM, Facebook and Instagram, and their relevant analytics tools.§        § §        §The person:§        § verbal communication skills§          §Team player§        §        §Recruitment agencies: please note that we are not seeking assistance on this role. This includes the investment management of AMP capital’s various property portfolios; the day – to – day management of the office, industrial and shopping centre properties in which AMP Capital invests; and researching new property opportunities.§AMP Capital Shopping Centres (AMPCSC) sits within the Real Estate division of AMP Capital Investors, and provides asset, development, and property management expertise to the shopping centres owned and/ or managed by AMP Capital Investor’s various property funds and private clients.§ §The role:§An exciting opportunity has arisen for an experienced Digital Marketing Executive to join the team at Botany Town Centre.§The role is responsible for supporting the Marketing team in developing, managing, and delivering digital assets, centre communication, retailer communication and executing brand aligned partnerships and events with a focus on driving centre traffic and retail sales.§The primary areas of focus will be Digital Marketing, Market Intelligence, Retailer Engagement, Centre Communication and Event Delivery.§This person will be responsible for managing all of the digital, social, and digital analytics platforms for the centre, including website, EDM, Facebook and Instagram, and their relevant analytics tools.§ §The person:§§Minimum 3 years’ experience in a digital marketing role§Proven experience in producing digital strategies and digital project management§Customer focus with can do attitude§Flexibility and agility when faced with challenging plans and situations§Digital technology and social media strategy skills§Ability to deliver key initiatives on time§Ability to manage upwards and deal with competing workloads§Ability to identify key priorities and develop timelines/ critical paths§Manage tasks on time and within budget§High attention to detail§Ability to establish relationships with key business stakeholders§Ability to work under pressure§Excellent written and verbal communication skills§Team player§§Recruitment agencies: please note that we are not seeking assistance on this role. jobTitle: Property Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
xenophobe: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?
jobText: TXT/50642610.txt	§Property Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property Manager§§Advertiser: §Quotable Value Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Leasing & Property Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Property Manager§      §        §QV’s commercial property management and consultancy business (Darroch) is looking for an outstanding property professional whom will be responsible for the delivery of Property management solutions in the Auckland office for one of our large infrastructure portfolios.  §        §The role of the Property Manager is to deliver a broad scope of services to a major Property Management client. The role will report directly to the Manager Portfolio Services in Auckland, and will primarily involve the management and coordination of a large residential property management portfolio across Auckland and Northland, as well as other duties that may arise.§        §The core role responsibilities include;§        §          §Maintaining accuracy of property and tenancy data in the Client’s database (SAP)§          §The day-to-day Management of all residential tenancies§          §Negotiate Tenancy Agreements and other formal arrangements as necessary§          §Completing rent reviews§          §Managing tenancy bond requirements§          §Complete property inspections for residential and other types of properties in the portfolio§          §Manage financial targets, budgets, forecasts and reporting requirements§          §Managing invoice processing system§          §Provide instructions and carry out debt recovery activities§          §Maintain data integrity and record keeping obligations§          §Liaise with client’s legal team to ensure that all property and lease instruments are correct and consistent with client data§        §        §You will have the opportunity to apply your proven pro-active and agile management skills to a diverse property portfolio of properties held pre and post project delivery.§        §About You§        §To be successful in this role you will require the following;§        §          §Outstanding communication skills and strong delivery focus§          §A high standard of written and oral presentation skills§          §Excellent relationship management and interpersonal skills.  Ability to network across many levels and industries. This role demands a client interface and requires the mentoring and support of a team to build secure relationships.§          §Liaise with client’s legal team to ensure that all property and lease instruments are correct and consistent with client data§          §A relevant sector tertiary qualification is desirable but not essential for this role.§        §        §About Us§        §We’re an ambitious property insights business investing in our future.  Our goal is to revolutionise how property information is shared and experienced, to enable our customers to make better decisions.  100% New Zealand owned, QV is focused on its customers and they’re at the heart of what we do.  As a State-Owned Enterprise, we’re proud to help our local communities.§        §Our people are vital to our success.  That’s why we’re proud to offer flexible working arrangements, enabling people to fit work around their busy life schedule.  Offering a competitive remuneration package and professional development, supporting our people to reach their full potential.§        § §        §If you like the sound of that – and you’re keen to join a team of energetic and driven people keen to make a real difference for New Zealanders – then we’d like to hear from you.§      §      §    §    §  §§§QV’s commercial property management and consultancy business (Darroch) is looking for an outstanding property professional whom will be responsible for the delivery of Property management solutions in the Auckland office for one of our large infrastructure portfolios.  § §The role of the Property Manager is to deliver a broad scope of services to a major Property Management client. The role will report directly to the Manager Portfolio Services in Auckland, and will primarily involve the management and coordination of a large residential property management portfolio across Auckland and Northland, as well as other duties that may arise.§ §The core role responsibilities include;§ § §Maintaining accuracy of property and tenancy data in the Client’s database (SAP)§ §The day-to-day Management of all residential tenancies§ §Negotiate Tenancy Agreements and other formal arrangements as necessary§ §Completing rent reviews§ §Managing tenancy bond requirements§ §Complete property inspections for residential and other types of properties in the portfolio§ §Manage financial targets, budgets, forecasts and reporting requirements§ §Managing invoice processing system§ §Provide instructions and carry out debt recovery activities§ §Maintain data integrity and record keeping obligations§ §Liaise with client’s legal team to ensure that all property and lease instruments are correct and consistent with client data§ §You will have the opportunity to apply your proven pro-active and agile management skills to a diverse property portfolio of properties held pre and post project delivery.§ §About You§ §To be successful in this role you will require the following;§ § §Outstanding communication skills and strong delivery focus§ §A high standard of written and oral presentation skills§ §Excellent relationship management and interpersonal skills.  Ability to network across many levels and industries. This role demands a client interface and requires the mentoring and support of a team to build secure relationships.§ §Liaise with client’s legal team to ensure that all property and lease instruments are correct and consistent with client data§ §A relevant sector tertiary qualification is desirable but not essential for this role.§ §About Us§ §We’re an ambitious property insights business investing in our future.  Our goal is to revolutionise how property information is shared and experienced, to enable our customers to make better decisions.  100% New Zealand owned, QV is focused on its customers and they’re at the heart of what we do.  As a State-Owned Enterprise, we’re proud to help our local communities.§ §Our people are vital to our success.  That’s why we’re proud to offer flexible working arrangements, enabling people to fit work around their busy life schedule.  Offering a competitive remuneration package and professional development, supporting our people to reach their full potential.§ § § §If you like the sound of that – and you’re keen to join a team of energetic and driven people keen to make a real difference for New Zealanders – then we’d like to hear from you.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a property manager?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50643287.txt	§Property and Facilities Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property and Facilities Manager§§Advertiser: §Quotable Value Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Body Corporate & Facilities Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Property and Facilities Manager§      §        §QV’s commercial property management and consultancy business (Darroch) is looking for an outstanding property professional whom will be responsible for the delivery of Property & Facilities Management solutions in the Auckland office in servicing one of our large infrastructure portfolios.   §        §The role of the Property & Facilities Manager is to deliver a broad scope of services to a major Property Management client. The role will report directly to the Manager Portfolio Services in Auckland, and will involve the management and coordination of a range of Property Management and Project Management work across a unique combination of commercial, residential, and unleasable property across Auckland and Northland.§        §The core role responsibilities include;§        §          §Identify maintenance requirements and organise and prioritise remedial maintenance works§          §Manage planned maintenance activities for the portfolio§          §Track progress of maintenance jobs and update relevant people accordingly§          §Manage Contractor and Supplier KPIs and Targets§          §Manage all building and compliance requirements§          §Coordinate multiple onsite parties during works§          §Develop and implement new systems and operational procedures§        §        §You will have the opportunity to apply your proven pro-active and agile management skills to a diverse property portfolio of properties held pre and post project delivery.§        §About You§        §To be successful in this role you will require the following;§        §          §Outstanding communication skills and strong delivery focus§          §A high standard of written and oral presentation skills§          §Excellent relationship management and interpersonal skills.  Ability to network across many levels and industries. This role demands a client interface and requires the mentoring and support of a team to build secure relationships.§          §A relevant sector tertiary qualification is desirable but not essential for this role.§        §        §About Us§        §We’re an ambitious property insights business investing in our future.  Our goal is to revolutionise how property information is shared and experienced, to enable our customers to make better decisions.  100% New Zealand owned, QV is focused on its customers and they’re at the heart of what we do.  As a State-Owned Enterprise, we’re proud to help our local communities.§        §Our people are vital to our success.  That’s why we’re proud to offer flexible working arrangements, enabling people to fit work around their busy life schedule.  Offering a competitive remuneration package and professional development, supporting our people to reach their full potential.§        § §        §If you like the sound of that – and you’re keen to join a team of energetic and driven people keen to make a real difference for New Zealanders – then we’d like to hear from you.§      §      §    §    §  §§§QV’s commercial property management and consultancy business (Darroch) is looking for an outstanding property professional whom will be responsible for the delivery of Property & Facilities Management solutions in the Auckland office in servicing one of our large infrastructure portfolios.   § §The role of the Property & Facilities Manager is to deliver a broad scope of services to a major Property Management client. The role will report directly to the Manager Portfolio Services in Auckland, and will involve the management and coordination of a range of Property Management and Project Management work across a unique combination of commercial, residential, and unleasable property across Auckland and Northland.§ §The core role responsibilities include;§ § §Identify maintenance requirements and organise and prioritise remedial maintenance works§ §Manage planned maintenance activities for the portfolio§ §Track progress of maintenance jobs and update relevant people accordingly§ §Manage Contractor and Supplier KPIs and Targets§ §Manage all building and compliance requirements§ §Coordinate multiple onsite parties during works§ §Develop and implement new systems and operational procedures§ §You will have the opportunity to apply your proven pro-active and agile management skills to a diverse property portfolio of properties held pre and post project delivery.§ §About You§ §To be successful in this role you will require the following;§ § §Outstanding communication skills and strong delivery focus§ §A high standard of written and oral presentation skills§ §Excellent relationship management and interpersonal skills.  Ability to network across many levels and industries. This role demands a client interface and requires the mentoring and support of a team to build secure relationships.§ §A relevant sector tertiary qualification is desirable but not essential for this role.§ §About Us§ §We’re an ambitious property insights business investing in our future.  Our goal is to revolutionise how property information is shared and experienced, to enable our customers to make better decisions.  100% New Zealand owned, QV is focused on its customers and they’re at the heart of what we do.  As a State-Owned Enterprise, we’re proud to help our local communities.§ §Our people are vital to our success.  That’s why we’re proud to offer flexible working arrangements, enabling people to fit work around their busy life schedule.  Offering a competitive remuneration package and professional development, supporting our people to reach their full potential.§ § § §If you like the sound of that – and you’re keen to join a team of energetic and driven people keen to make a real difference for New Zealanders – then we’d like to hear from you.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a facilities manager?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50653829.txt	§Coastal - Sales§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Coastal - Sales§§Advertiser: §Qestral Corporation Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Nelson§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Other§§§§§§Qestral Corporation Ltd is a company specialising in the development of new generation retirement villages, with a strong focus on “§lifestyle§”. Our approach is design-led and anti-institutional and our philosophy is to create communities that bring together and combine the very latest thinking, facilities and the very best people, in terms of: design, healthcare, wellness, hospitality, and technology. §  § §  §Qestral’s latest village, Coastal View, will be opening this year and we have an exciting opportunity for a dynamic salesperson to join the team!§  § §  §This unique, exciting development is situated at the top of the Tahunanui Hills with a spectacular view over Tasman Bay, out to Rabbit Island. The village will offer architecturally designed independent living houses, serviced apartments and spacious care suites and offer the very best in resthome, hospital and specialised dementia level care. Coastal View will also provide a wide range of premium on-site facilities including a restaurant, library, café, hairdressing salon, medical centre, indoor swimming pool, gym, bakery and wellness centre, as well as an extensive programme of activities and events for residents to enjoy. It will be a dynamic environment, including the full spectrum of integrated care.§  § §  §We are seeking a highly motivated salesperson dedicated to meeting targets and helping retirees navigate retirement living options within our village. Knowledge of the retirement village sector is useful but not a necessity for the right person. A full, current New Zealand driver’s licence is required.§  § §  §In this role you will:§ § §Manage all aspects of the sales process from enquiries to completing sales§ §Conduct regular open days in line with Qestral marketing plan§ §Understand the regional housing market and clientele§ §Provide weekly sales information to Qestral head office§ §Ensure that the legal contracts and lawyer communications are properly handled§ §Work as part of a team and be flexible to partially work weekends§ §The right candidate will have:§ § §An ability to engage with all walks of life§ §Intermediate knowledge in Microsoft Office software and be capable with other database management systems§ §Excellent negotiation skills§ §Previous sales or industry experience (preferred)§ §Good organisational skills§ §Strong written and verbal communication skills§ §Empathy and the ability to interact with people showing confidence, credibility and discretion.§ § §  §If you are passionate, loyal and self-motivated to get results and make a difference in Retirement living then we want to hear from you!§  § §  §Coastal View is a new addition to the Qestral portfolio – a well resourced company with extensive experience in this industry. Check out the Qestral website (which refers to our other villages and board of directors) at www.qestral.co.nz  or our Christchurch villages at  www.alpineview.co.nz and www.burlingtonvillage.co.nz§  § §  §To take up this exciting and rewarding role and be part of a team dedicated to providing the very best in new generation retirement living, please send your CV and cover letter to §recruitment@qestral.co.nz§ with a reference of ‘Coastal - Sales’§  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have experience in a sales role?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§Do you have customer service experience?§§§

jobText: TXT/50656726.txt	§Senior Advisor, Clearances§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Advisor, Clearances§§Advertiser: §Land Information New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Advisor, Clearances §      §      §      §        §About the LINZ Clearances Team§        § §        §As a thriving part of our Crown Property business unit, our Clearances team has an important role to play in the buying, use and disposal of land assets across New Zealand. Working in close collaboration with a variety of other Government Agencies, we play an active role in managing major housing, roading or infrastructure projects, buying or designating land for new school developments or any of the other multitude of improvement projects required to keep New Zealand moving forwards. We work closely with a variety of other Government Agencies and support the work they are doing. §        § §        §About the Role§        § §        §Our Clearances team has a major role to play in facilitating timely and efficient land acquisitions for a number of large, nationwide projects over the next 5 years.  These projects will significantly boost productivity across road, rail, public transport, walking and cycling infrastructure. To support our role in achieving these goals, we have a §Senior Advisor, Clearances§ role available.§        § §        §Our Clearances team is made up of enthusiastic and technically savvy professionals. Day to day, they manage quality assurance on work submitted by accredited suppliers acting for vendor agencies and make strong, reason based statutory decisions under delegation. We're looking for someone energetic, Agile and collaborative who is seeking to further build on their existing experience and build a knowledge of the Public Works Act to provide technical expertise on Clearances issues, both inside and outside the team.§        § §        §This role offers you the opportunity to take the next step in your professional development and manage intellectually challenging pieces of work in a more autonomous way. With your continuous improvement focused mindset, you'll be well positioned to help us continue building the strategic agility within the Clearances team and provide technical insight to contribute to the review of legislation from a Clearances perspective.§        § §        §Ideally, you'll join us with previous experience in property, interpreting legislation, case law, standards & guidelines pragmatically - but we're not particular about which industry you've gained this ability in, as long as you are interested in the NZ land and property industry and are willing to build a new area of subject matter expertise. These capabilities, combined with your excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills, will see you build strong networks amongst the Senior Advisors across the Crown Property team.  As part of your ongoing development, you'll develop the foresight to scan internal and external environments for issues that may be of concern and actively propose appropriate solutions or interventions. With your excellent written communication skills, you'll be comfortable peer reviewing others work and apply a critical thinking lens and insightful feedback, particularly when dealing with sensitive and complex subject matter.§        § §        §At LINZ we aim to set our new staff up for success, long-term opportunities for professional development and enjoyable career pathways with us. To help you in this role, you may have previous professional experience in a valuation, property, policy, conveyancing, or legal background. Strong written communication skills, scrupulous attention to detail and a focus on quality assurance, excellent record keeping, and workload prioritization skills will be essential. You'll also have previous experience building strong key stakeholder relationships and communicating appropriately to meet the needs of diverse audiences.§        § §        §Please note; if this role is of interest to you, but you feel your experience places you at more of an "Advisor" level, rather than a Senior, we have the flexibility to consider your application and provide you with development and upskilling.§        § §        §Due to the urgent need for these positions, we'll be applying an "as you go" shortlisting approach to this recruitment. What this means is that we'll be contacting suitable candidates to discuss the next steps of the process with them, prior to this advertisement closing - so the sooner you lodge your application the better. §        § §        §H§ow to Apply§        §To apply, please click "Apply Online." You'll be taken through to our LINZ Careers Centre where you'll be able to review further information about the responsibilities and accountabilities of this role in the Position Description.  You'll be able to complete your online application form and upload a copy of your CV/Cover Letter.  Please keep in mind when including your CV to specifically highlight the capabilities and skills listed in the above ad and the position description.§        §Applications close 14th October 2020§        §If you have any questions about this role or working at LINZ, please email opportunities@linz.govt.nz and our Recruitment Team will be in touch with you.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§About the LINZ Clearances Team§ §As a thriving part of our Crown Property business unit, our Clearances team has an important role to play in the buying, use and disposal of land assets across New Zealand. Working in close collaboration with a variety of other Government Agencies, we play an active role in managing major housing, roading or infrastructure projects, buying or designating land for new school developments or any of the other multitude of improvement projects required to keep New Zealand moving forwards. We work closely with a variety of other Government Agencies and support the work they are doing. § §About the Role§ §Our Clearances team has a major role to play in facilitating timely and efficient land acquisitions for a number of large, nationwide projects over the next 5 years.  These projects will significantly boost productivity across road, rail, public transport, walking and cycling infrastructure. To support our role in achieving these goals, we have a §Senior Advisor, Clearances§ role available.§ §Our Clearances team is made up of enthusiastic and technically savvy professionals. Day to day, they manage quality assurance on work submitted by accredited suppliers acting for vendor agencies and make strong, reason based statutory decisions under delegation. We're looking for someone energetic, Agile and collaborative who is seeking to further build on their existing experience and build a knowledge of the Public Works Act to provide technical expertise on Clearances issues, both inside and outside the team.§ §This role offers you the opportunity to take the next step in your professional development and manage intellectually challenging pieces of work in a more autonomous way. With your continuous improvement focused mindset, you'll be well positioned to help us continue building the strategic agility within the Clearances team and provide technical insight to contribute to the review of legislation from a Clearances perspective.§ §Ideally, you'll join us with previous experience in property, interpreting legislation, case law, standards & guidelines pragmatically - but we're not particular about which industry you've gained this ability in, as long as you are interested in the NZ land and property industry and are willing to build a new area of subject matter expertise. These capabilities, combined with your excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills, will see you build strong networks amongst the Senior Advisors across the Crown Property team.  As part of your ongoing development, you'll develop the foresight to scan internal and external environments for issues that may be of concern and actively propose appropriate solutions or interventions. With your excellent written communication skills, you'll be comfortable peer reviewing others work and apply a critical thinking lens and insightful feedback, particularly when dealing with sensitive and complex subject matter.§ §At LINZ we aim to set our new staff up for success, long-term opportunities for professional development and enjoyable career pathways with us. To help you in this role, you may have previous professional experience in a valuation, property, policy, conveyancing, or legal background. Strong written communication skills, scrupulous attention to detail and a focus on quality assurance, excellent record keeping, and workload prioritization skills will be essential. You'll also have previous experience building strong key stakeholder relationships and communicating appropriately to meet the needs of diverse audiences.§ §Please note; if this role is of interest to you, but you feel your experience places you at more of an "Advisor" level, rather than a Senior, we have the flexibility to consider your application and provide you with development and upskilling.§ §§Due to the urgent need for these positions, we'll be applying an "as you go" shortlisting approach to this recruitment. What this means is that we'll be contacting suitable candidates to discuss the next steps of the process with them, prior to this advertisement closing - so the sooner you lodge your application the better. §§ §H§ow to Apply§§To apply, please click "Apply Online." You'll be taken through to our LINZ Careers Centre where you'll be able to review further information about the responsibilities and accountabilities of this role in the Position Description.  You'll be able to complete your online application form and upload a copy of your CV/Cover Letter.  Please keep in mind when including your CV to specifically highlight the capabilities and skills listed in the above ad and the position description.§Applications close 14th October 2020§If you have any questions about this role or working at LINZ, please email opportunities@linz.govt.nz and our Recruitment Team will be in touch with you.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50657810.txt	§Property Advisor - Dunedin§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property Advisor - Dunedin§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Education§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Other§§§§§§Kia ora, Bula Vinaka, Fakaalofa lahi atu, Fakatalofa atu, Kia orana, Malo e lelei, Malo ni, Talofa lava, Tena koutou katoa, and welcome.§Permanent - full-time§Relationship management§Asset management§Strategic vision§Help shape the future of education§At the Ministry of Education, we work together to shape an education system that delivers equitable and excellent outcomes.§Our organisation is made up of more than 3,000 talented and committed people around New Zealand, from a wide range of backgrounds and cultures.§While we work in different groups and on different things, we all strive every day to make the biggest difference we can for every child, young person and adult student in our education system.§About us§Education Infrastructure Service (EIS), a part of the Ministry of Education, creates and supports safe, healthy, inspiring and ICT enabled learning environments. EIS manages the Crown's second largest property portfolio of around 2,100 schools with a book value of $18.3 billion, is responsible for the largest payroll in the country, and transports over 100,000 students to and from school each day.§About the role§You will be providing advice and support for the management of a portfolio of schools over the short, medium and long term to meet ongoing and future educational requirements.§Your key priorities will include the following:§Developing effective relationships and trust with schools§Working with individual Schools to develop an asset management plan so they are effectively managing and maintaining their school property and infrastructure§Ensuring schools implement projects and spending supports the school's pedagogy and/or Ministry Asset Strategy§Following and working within Ministry and EIS policy, procedures and guidelines and providing the right advice to schools§Ensuring Ministry information and data is kept up to date and accurate§Working collaboratively across the team to share technical knowledge and experience with others so all portfolios are well supported and there is consistent delivery of service§Working collaboratively with other teams within the Ministry and EIS to provide effective property and infrastructure solutions that support teaching and learning§About you§To be successful in this role you will need to be an amazing people person and be an excellent communicator with proven skills in building and managing strong, effective relationships. Your ability to understand your audience, their vision and motivations is critical. You will be able to adapt your communication style to be able to effectively deliver a range of messages to a variety of people.§You will also offer the following:§Demonstrated ability to plan and implement initiatives and achieve positive results§Ability to interpret, plainly articulate the intent, and apply policy appropriately§Ability to manage and prioritise competing demands§Problem solving, have the ability to apply a variety of approaches to solve problems or identify options to achieve great outcomes§Relevant professional qualification or experience such as asset management, project management, property management or construction§A full, current and clean driver's licence§If you'd like to bring your skills to a challenging but rewarding role within an organisation that's continuously reaching goals and striving for a better future for New Zealand, we'd love to hear from you.§The Otago/Southland based team is a high performing team with a 'can-do' attitude. We work collaboratively to support each other to provide the region's schools an outstanding, professional service.§Are you ready to make a difference?§We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds, including Māori, Pacific and those with disabilities, who will enrich our understanding of the education system.§As a government agency, the Ministry is committed to keeping to the Treaty of Waitangi's guiding principles in our work for and with Māori students, their whānau, hapū and iwi.§Please review the job description and if this opportunity interests you, and you meet the requirements, apply now using the 'apply online' button. §For further information please contact Stephanie Phillips at §eis.recruitment@education.govt.nz§§ Applications close midnight on Sunday, 11 October 2020.§Click here to view the role description§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Business Development Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
xenophobe: The primary role of the Business Development Manager is to sell residential property management agreements through the application of business growth and marketing strategies. This could be through personal networks, corporate relationship building, cold outreach, or and any other strategies you can bring to the table. The Business Development Manager is required to define long term strategic goals, build key customer relationships, identify business opportunities, negotiate and close business deals and maintain extensive knowledge of current market conditions and most importantly maintain a high level of sales activity designed to convert to new managements.
jobText: TXT/50660826.txt	§Business Development Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Development Manager§§Advertiser: §Quinovic Mt Eden§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Leasing & Property Management§§§§§§The Company§ §Our company believes people are the key to success, hiring only the best to grow and develop our property management services across the country. We value perseverance, gumption, and a gung-ho attitude. If you are looking for a role that provides the freedom to reap your own rewards, we would love to hear from you!§ §Quinovic Mt Eden is a company that was the first of the franchises established originally in Mt Albert in 1989. We now have a rich 30+ year history in Auckland having housed many thousands of Kiwi’s and cared for many hundreds of clients and their homes during this time. Quinovic Mt Eden provides a dedicated property management service to investors throughout Auckland who care about their returns. Quinovic Mt Eden has proven systems that guarantee top occupancy rates, excellent tenant co-operation and the highest care and returns for your asset.§ §We have the highest retention rate and the highest proportion of clients through referrals. § § §10,000 tenants housed§ §30+ years’ experience§ §90% retention rate§ §10yrs average client tenure (industry average is 3yrs)§ §Feel free to check us out at https://quinovicmteden.co.nz/.§ § § §The Role§ §The primary role of the Business Development Manager is to sell residential property management agreements through the application of business growth and marketing strategies. This could be through personal networks, corporate relationship building, cold outreach, or and any other strategies you can bring to the table. The Business Development Manager is required to define long term strategic goals, build key customer relationships, identify business opportunities, negotiate and close business deals and maintain extensive knowledge of current market conditions and most importantly maintain a high level of sales activity designed to convert to new managements.§ § § §Key Attributes§ § §Self-driven§ §Clear communicator§ §Entrepreneurial§ §Personable § §Previous experience in real estate§ §Ideally qualified with a BProp and licensed with NZ Real Estate Authority§ §However, skills and experience are less important to us than attitude!§§§§

jobTitle: Project Sales Consultant Job in Auckland - SEEK
xenophobe: Our current projects are aimed at the most active part of the residential market and we have a culture of excellence and collaboration that provides our people with the ideal platform to develop their skills and accelerate their careers.  For you, this means a world of opportunity and the platform to learn, grow and succeed.
jobText: TXT/50661341.txt	§Project Sales Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Project Sales Consultant§§Advertiser: §Colliers International§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Sales§§§§§§Company Description§ §Colliers International is a global property services company and best employer operating across 68 countries. We have a workforce of more than 17,000 professionals who think differently, share great ideas and provide service excellence to their clients. § §Colliers have been involved in some of Auckland’s most successful developments – Alexandra Park Epsom, Fabric Onehunga, Boatshed Bay Snells Beach, OKLA Albany, Fraser Avenue Northcote, Kotuitui Manukau – all first-class residential developments marketed and sold by our leading Residential Projects team.§ §We have new and exciting affordable residential projects, well-designed and aimed at the most active part of Auckland’s residential market; these new projects will be in market over the coming months.§ § §Job Description§ §Do you love real estate, enjoy architectural design and want to work with some of Auckland’s leading residential developers?§ §You may be starting your journey in residential sales and struggling to obtain listings or may be an experienced salesperson looking to try something different. Either way this opportunity is not one to be missed.§ §Our cutting-edge marketing programmes direct traffic to on-site sales display suites and straight to your phone, making your role a relatively simple one – listen to what prospective owners want and guide them through the different product offerings within the developments until they have enough information to be confident in purchasing their brand new home. How exciting!§ §Qualifications§ §We are looking for qualified salespeople that have a high level of customer service, proactive and effective electronic and personal communication skills, professional presentation and genuinely enjoy selling real estate. Your relationship management skills will be second to none, you will love working with prospects and purchasers, a team environment and be a results-driven professional.§ §You will be skilled at developing relationships to identify and connect with prospective purchasers from all backgrounds from initial enquiry stage right through to a successful sale, whilst collaborating with the wider Colliers network to maximise referral opportunities.§ §Please note you must hold a §current Real Estate Salesperson's License§ to be eligible for this role.§ §Additional Information§ §Our current projects are aimed at the most active part of the residential market and we have a culture of excellence and collaboration that provides our people with the ideal platform to develop their skills and accelerate their careers.  For you, this means a world of opportunity and the platform to learn, grow and succeed.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50662091.txt	§Registered Property Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Registered Property Consultant§§Advertiser: §Quotable Value Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Valuation§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Registered Property Consultant §      §        §We’re on the look-out for a registered Senior Property Consultant to join our QV team ideally based in Christchurch, Wellington or Auckland.  §        §This role will assist us with a growing book of Advisory and Asset work. As a Qualified Senior Property Consultant you will be working in a future focused Operations team responsible for undertaking QV’s national programme of asset and portfolio valuations. You will also support the Consultancy team, providing valuation services for clients and you will be expected to contribute to the development of the business, including prospecting for new customers. You will also mentor and train staff within the team, as and when required.§        §About you:§        §          §A degree in Valuation recognised by the New Zealand registration board.§          §Registration with the New Zealand Valuer’s Registration board. §          §Proven knowledge in the Property Industry, ideally in Financial Reporting, Insurance and Commercial valuation methodologies including an excellent understanding of relevant legislation and standards.§          §Demonstrable experience in the valuation industry (preferably in NZ) with the proven ability to complete work to market standards.§          §Good written and verbal communication skills with the ability to handle sensitive and confidential material with integrity.§          §Sound time-management with the ability to work under high pressure.§          §A genuine interest interacting with others, and be an active team player.§          §A collaborative working style yet be able to stand on your own two feet.§        §        § §        §About us§        §Quotable Value (QV) is New Zealand’s leading national property focused business. Proudly Kiwi owned, we strive to apply next generation technology that supports better real-time property decisions.§        §We want to transform how Kiwis consume and share property information. Our goal is to apply next generation technology that supports better real-time property decisions. We are also proud to be a State-Owned Enterprise and the help we provide our local communities to grow and prosper.§        §Our people are vital to our success.  That’s why we’re proud to offer flexible working arrangements, enabling people to fit work around their busy life schedule.  Offering a competitive remuneration package and professional development, supporting our people to reach their full potential.§        § §        §If you like the sound of that – and you’re keen to join a team of energetic and driven people keen to make a real difference for New Zealanders – then we’d like to hear from you.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§We’re on the look-out for a registered Senior Property Consultant to join our QV team ideally based in Christchurch, Wellington or Auckland.  § §This role will assist us with a growing book of Advisory and Asset work. As a Qualified Senior Property Consultant you will be working in a future focused Operations team responsible for undertaking QV’s national programme of asset and portfolio valuations. You will also support the Consultancy team, providing valuation services for clients and you will be expected to contribute to the development of the business, including prospecting for new customers. You will also mentor and train staff within the team, as and when required.§ §About you:§ § §A degree in Valuation recognised by the New Zealand registration board.§ §Registration with the New Zealand Valuer’s Registration board. § §Proven knowledge in the Property Industry, ideally in Financial Reporting, Insurance and Commercial valuation methodologies including an excellent understanding of relevant legislation and standards.§ §Demonstrable experience in the valuation industry (preferably in NZ) with the proven ability to complete work to market standards.§ §Good written and verbal communication skills with the ability to handle sensitive and confidential material with integrity.§ §Sound time-management with the ability to work under high pressure.§ §A genuine interest interacting with others, and be an active team player.§ §A collaborative working style yet be able to stand on your own two feet.§ § § §About us§ §Quotable Value (QV) is New Zealand’s leading national property focused business. Proudly Kiwi owned, we strive to apply next generation technology that supports better real-time property decisions.§ §We want to transform how Kiwis consume and share property information. Our goal is to apply next generation technology that supports better real-time property decisions. We are also proud to be a State-Owned Enterprise and the help we provide our local communities to grow and prosper.§ §Our people are vital to our success.  That’s why we’re proud to offer flexible working arrangements, enabling people to fit work around their busy life schedule.  Offering a competitive remuneration package and professional development, supporting our people to reach their full potential.§ § § §If you like the sound of that – and you’re keen to join a team of energetic and driven people keen to make a real difference for New Zealanders – then we’d like to hear from you.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

As well as being a valued member of the team at LJ Hooker you will have the backing of the LJ Hooker group, one of the largest and most successful brands in Australasia.  §  § This role is being managed by REAP Recruitment. jobTitle: LOOKING FOR A CHANGE? Real Estate Careers Evening Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50672942.txt	§LOOKING FOR A CHANGE? Real Estate Careers Evening§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§LOOKING FOR A CHANGE? Real Estate Careers Evening§§Advertiser: §NetYourJob§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Real Estate & Property§, §Residential Sales§§§§§§We're looking for driven, service-focused people with a passion to succeed to join our award-winning sales team at Harcourts Grenadier. This is an opportunity to enjoy uncapped earning potential within a highly trusted, reputable company.§ §Our next career evening:§When: Tuesday 13th October 2020 at 6pm§Where: Harcourts Grenadier, 98 Moorhouse Avenue, Christchurch§ §Fast track your real estate career with §Grenadier Advantage§. A first in the country, Grenadier Advantage provides the best training and support to build your business from day one. Grenadier Advantage has been created and designed for motivated individuals that have a desire to start a successful and rewarding career in real estate. You will be mentored and coached alongside other like-minded consultants by our in-house, highly experienced real estate trainer. It truly will give you the perfect platform to accelerate your career and your income.§ §For those who require financial assistance while they transition to their new career we have created §Grenadier Advantage+§. This offers you all the training benefits mentioned above plus up to 20 weeks base salary.§ §The ideal candidate would have:§ § § The desire to build a long-lasting career§ §A strong focus on customer service§ §Enthusiasm and a positive attitude§ §High levels of self-motivation and self-drive§ §A strong local network or the ability to build one quickly§ §Get the advantage over everyone else and join Grenadier!§ §Spaces will be limited so it is important that you register your attendance at www.careerinrealestate.co.nz to secure your spot!§ §For a confidential discussion about a future with us please contact Anna Penny Moore, Business Operations Officer on 021 046 6097.§§§§
